symptoms.turf: Silver dollar-sized bleached spots, sunken lesions
symptoms.leaf: Hourglass-shaped lesions with tan centers and reddish-brown margins
symptoms.morning: White cottony mycelium visible in dew

cultural_control.nitrogen: Maintain adequate N (0.1-0.2 lb N/1000/week during pressure)
cultural_control.irrigation: Water early morning, avoid evening irrigation

chemical_control.resistance_concern: Common resistance to DMIs and SDHIs

symptoms.turf: Circular patches 6 inches to several feet, smoke ring at edge
symptoms.leaf: Irregular tan lesions with dark borders
symptoms.morning: Gray-purple 'smoke ring' visible in morning dew

cultural_control.nitrogen: Reduce N during high-risk periods (<0.25 lb N/1000)
cultural_control.irrigation: Water early morning only, deep and infrequent

chemical_control.preventive_timing: Begin when night temps reach 60F for 2-3 nights

pythium_blight.pathogen_type: Oomycete (water mold) - not a true fungus

symptoms.turf: Greasy, water-soaked patches that turn brown, streaked pattern

pythium_blight.spread_pattern: Can follow drainage, spread rapidly overnight

chemical_control.note: Standard fungicides do NOT work - need Oomycete-specific products

symptoms.turf: Circular patches with green centers (frog-eye), bronze to straw color
symptoms.root: Dark, rotted roots with black strands (runner hyphae)

environmental_triggers.stress: Heat and drought stress trigger symptoms

summer_patch.timing: Root infection in spring, symptoms appear in summer

cultural_control.pH: Acidify to 6.0 with sulfur or ammonium sulfate
cultural_control.irrigation: Deep, infrequent to encourage deep roots

chemical_control.timing: Apply when soil temp reaches 65F (before symptoms)
chemical_control.application: Water in immediately to reach roots

symptoms.foliar: Irregular yellow patches, black acervuli on leaves
symptoms.basal: Rotted crowns and stolons, plants pull easily

environmental_triggers.stress: Any stress - heat, drought, low N, compaction, low mowing
environmental_triggers.temperature: Symptoms appear in summer heat stress

anthracnose.key_concept: Weak pathogen - only attacks stressed turf

chemical_control.note: Cultural practices are more important than fungicides

symptoms.turf: Bronze to brown patches, often with Poa annua centers
symptoms.root: Black, rotted roots with dark runner hyphae

environmental_triggers.manganese: Low Mn availability at high pH
environmental_triggers.new_establishment: More severe in newly established areas

chemical_control.timing: Apply in fall and spring preventively
